items.title: News Explorer Is a Pretty Great Feed Reader
items.content_html: I am currently using News Explorer for reading feeds. There are clients for both iOS and Mac, and they are improving all the time. What I like most about it is that it syncs over iCloud rather than via some third party service. It works really well, and I don’t have to depend on some service to continue existing forever. I keep the data in my own little iCloud silo.
Finally getting in some solid bike time. Beautiful day for it.
It’s 70 degrees out and everyone has the heat cranked up to 80. The world’s gone mad.
Definitely not the droids I’m looking for.
I’ve been sitting in traffic at a dead stop for two hours because a big-rig truck overturned (predictably?) on a curvy mountain road. I am using the time to rethink my life.

Headline: Intel reportedly considering launching smart glasses this year. Presumably before they announce these plans, they are trying to make sure they can cram in a white-hot Spectre-and-Meltdown-sporting x86 processor and a huge cooling fan.
I’m tired of visualizing. The time has come to actualize.

items.title: Might Lifetime Subscriptions Be the Answer to Subscription Fatigue?
items.content_html: I’m considering the idea of adding a lifetime subscription option to LinkLocker. I think “subscription fatigue” is a very real phenomenon, and I personally understand where that feeling is coming from. I think I can set a price for lifetime access that will work from a business perspective, and I’m seriously considering this. I’m curious about what users of online services might think about such a model.
I should get out and work in coffee shops more often.
